summary: Each year from 2014-2018, about half of large corporations and a quarter of profitable ones didn't owe federal taxes. For example, profitable corporations may not owe taxes due to prior years' losses. Average effective tax rates—the percentage of income paid after tax breaks—among profitable large corporations fell from 16% in 2014 to 9% in 2018. A 2017 tax law lowered the top corporate rate from...
title: Corporate Income Tax: Effective Rates Before and After 2017 Law Change
